TextAsset.value: (Okay, so Richard’s first impression was…)
(Uh…)
(Well, it was certainly an impression.)
(But the Culinary Club sounds like it’d be a fun way to reduce my detention.)
(Maybe we’ll get to make cakes!)
(Eh, probably start us on something simpler like cookies.)
(But that’s okay too!)
(Wow, there’s so much food! It’s like a banquet. Is it like that in here EVERY DAY???)
And now for my finale!
(Did Richard make all that food?)
Ta-da!
(He…)
(He threw all of it in the trash?!?)
(What’s going on in here?!)
Ah, ${slot:playerName}. Glad you could make it.
You seem awfully busy. I’ll come by later, okay?
No, no. This is a great opportunity to discern your strengths and weaknesses for my dossiers.
Well, right now my weakness is for cake.
Cake, you say? Excellent timing. You can start on dessert while I complete the main course!
You want me to bake a cake on my first day?!
Oh! Haha, I’m sorry, ${slot:playerName}.
Sometimes I forget everyone else isn’t up to my speed.
Even so! You can make us some cupcakes instead.
Are those easier because they’re smaller?
No. Furthermore, that’s an absurd conclusion to come to. You’re really new to this cooking stuff aren’t you!
Hey! You don’t have to make fun of me for it. Everyone has to learn sometime, y’know…
Ah, too true. There’s a box of cupcake mix somewhere over there.
Got it.
That’ll get you started. Just follow the directions. It’s completely idiot proof, so you’ll do fine.
Tha--HEY!
Oh, no. You’re not an idiot.
Just sayin’! You’ve got nothing to worry about because even an idiot, which you are not, couldn’t screw it up.
Okay, then.
(Uh-oh. But what if I DO screw it up?)
(He’ll think I’m an idiot!!!)
(Hmm, maybe I’ll say the instructions were misprinted. Yeah! That’s the ticket.)
(Hold up though. Maybe first I should try to make the darn things before I worry about a cover story.)
(Okay, first up. Add some stuff to other stuff. That’s easy enough.)
Looks like you’re doing pretty good so far, ${slot:playerName}.
Yup, nothing’s on fire.
Always a good sign in the kitchen!
Oh, hand me that, will you?
Okay.
(Uh, which that? There’s like a dozen utensils and pots and pans and stuff over here!)
The spatula?
No, but I haven’t time to correct you!
(Wouldn’t it have taken just as long to say that as to correct me???)
Uh, okay, here!
Now I must prepare the duck confit with nothing but a spatula and a piece of string. It’s daring. Possibly never so much as attempted before.
But that’s what we’ve got and there’s no time to change course now!
I don’t know anything about how to cook stuff other than what this box of cupcake mix is telling me, but you might want to use some cookware?
And some heat? Like from an oven?
No time!
I think I’d make the time if it was me!
There’s no time to make time! Because I’m making five other dishes.
AT THE SAME TIME!
Wh-what?!
No one can cook at these speeds!
(At least, I think you can’t…?)
Ordinarily, no.
But everything is connected, ${slot:playerName}.
Literally, or figuratively, or directly, or indirectly, or sympathetically, or spatially.
BUT ALWAYS CHRONOLOGICALLY.
Uh, okay then…
(I guess the question of whether or not the fact that everything must exist in time means that everything is ALSO connected THROUGH the medium of time is beyond the scope of this conversation…)
(I think I hurt myself thinking about that…)
(But it basically it sounds right?)
Therefore, with precision timing, ANYTHING IS POSSIBLE!
I’m not sure that conclusion follows from your premise.
(Wow, I sound like a college professor!)
Maybe it does and maybe it doesn’t.
But you can’t argue with these results!!!
What the--?!
(How did he cook a whole meal right in front of me without an oven WHILE WE WERE TALKING?!?!)
(Oh, speaking of which! I need to put my cupcakes in the oven…)
(Like so!)
Wow, Richard.
Your duck-whatever-it-was smells delicious too!
Does it? How irrelevant.
Hm?
But good smelling food is GREAT!
It makes you anticipate getting to eat it and that makes it taste that much better when you do!
That’s a weird way to look at it, ${slot:playerName}.
ACK! We’ve wasted precious seconds talking about food!
(What’s he talking about?)
(And why did he put that duck thing in the trash?!)
Hey! What’re you doing?!
What do you mean? I’m making room for the next dish.
It’s not like we have time to sit around ENJOYING the food.
Much less eating it!
Uh. Then what’s the point of making it?
Why, to get the best time, of course!
Best time?!
What does that even mean?
It’s not like you can can bake a cake faster than the time it takes to bake that cake!
(I sure am thinking about cake a lot.)
(Dangit, why did he have to throw away all that food! Now I’m hungry and still thinking about cakes!)
If you throw away all the food you make, then what do you eat?
Why, fast food, of course.
(Ugh, I should’ve seen that one coming from a mile away…)

But drive-thru only. No one has time to park, walk inside, wait in line, order, wait for it, walk to a table, sit down, eat, and then throw away the trash, and walk ALL THE WAY BACK to the car, AND THEN leave.
That’d be crazy!
No, you do the drive-thru.

And the food can only be eaten while driving to wherever it is you’re going, and you can only drive at maximum speed because what’s the point of going any slower UNLESS you’re on your way to going as fast as you possibly can.
Isn’t that dangerous?
Heh, not with my reflexes!
What about the food though?
Fast food’s not as bad for us with fast metabolism. We can eat anything, really. Who’s stoppin’ us!
(That’s an... interesting point…)
But, no, I mean DRIVING and EATING at the same time?
Oh, that.
Yeah, it’s big time dangerous.
But that’s what CONTINUES are for.
(I feel like that can’t be the right answer…)
(And yet I don’t have an argument against it!)
DING!
Ack! What’s that mean? Did I do it wrong?
That’s the oven. Your cupcakes are done.
PERFECTLY TIMED to happen after my duck confit was finished.
Anyway, time to throw them in the trash!
Hey, wait! I didn’t make those to NOT have one!
(Man, I want some kinda cake before I leave here or I’ll go nuts.)
Anyway, they’re not done. They need icing.
A fair point.
But do it quickly!
There. That’s the first one done.
And into the trash it goes.
WAAAIIIIIIIIT!!!
ARGH!
Make it fast! I can’t wait for long!
Try EATING that one.
I just told you there isn’t time for that sort of thing!
But look at it.
It’s BITE-SIZED.
If it helps, just think of it as throwing it into the trashcan of your own organs.
Whoa, it does help!
GULP.
(Uh-oh! His face is all...uh...weird.)
(HE SAID IT WAS IDIOT PROOF THOUGH C’MON!)
This is…
(C’MON C’MON C’MON!)
It’s like…
There’s a happiness in my mouth.
Uh. Happiness?
Do you mean, like, a flavor?
So.
“Food” can have “flavor.”
Huh. I didn’t know that was possible.
(And I didn’t know it was possible not to know that!!!)
Yeah. Pretty much all food has a flavor, Richard.
Not true! I eat all kinds of fast food and when you’re lucky there’s no real taste at all.
(Probably swallows it whole because chewing would take too long!)
Well, yeah, that stuff’s not the best tasting. Or good for you in any way.
Why am I still waiting for the second cupcake!
(Darn it, I want some of these too!)
